title: Linux ping Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the ping command in Linux, learn how to use it for local and remote network troubleshooting, and gain practical experience with various ping command options.

steps.title: Understanding the Basics of ping Command

verify.name: Verify ping to local loopback
verify.hint: The ping command to the local loopback address 127.0.0.1 should be successful.

verify.name: Verify ping to remote host
verify.hint: The ping command to the remote host google.com should be successful.

verify.name: Verify ping to local host
verify.hint: The ping command to the local host 192.168.1.1 should be successful.

verify.name: Verify ping to remote host
verify.hint: The ping command to the remote host github.com should be successful.

verify.name: Verify ping to unreachable host
verify.hint: The ping command to the unreachable host 8.8.8.8 should show 100% packet loss.

verify.name: Verify ping to host with high response time
verify.hint: The ping command to the host slowweb.com should show a response time of around 1000 ms.

verify.name: Verify ping to host with high packet loss
verify.hint: The ping command to the host lossy.com should show a 50% packet loss.
